Package edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.prog

Class RepeatedNodeHeuristic

java.lang.Object
edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.prog.RepeatedNodeHeuristic
All Implemented Interfaces:
ProgressionCost
Direct Known Subclasses:
RepeatedRootHeuristic
public class RepeatedNodeHeuristic extends Object implements ProgressionCost
The repeated node heuristic is a wrapper around a cost function that can improve the efficiency of a heuristic progression search by preventing it from revisiting the same node multiple times. Each time this cost function evaluates a node, it calculates the sum of its temporal offset and temporal depth. If the node has never been evaluated before, or if that sum is less than the last time the node was evaluated, that sum is recorded and this heuristic passes thru to the heuristic it wraps around. If the node has been evaluated before, and if the sum is greater than or equal to the recorded sum, this heuristic returns positive infinity. This prevents a node from being visited more than once at the same temporal level. The sum of temporal offset and depth is checked because a previous search of the same node might have failed due to search's temporal limits, so repeating the search at a lower temporal level might succeed.
Author:
Stephen G. Ware
